head.title: Newly Released Names of Dead In the Iraq War

hedline.hl1: Newly Released Names of Dead In the Iraq War
hedline.hl2: Newly Released Names of Dead in the Iraq War

abstract.p: List of Americans killed in Iraq war reported since Mar 30 by Defense Dept (M)

block.p: Following is a list of Americans killed in the Iraq war reported since Saturday by the Department of Defense:
BLAIR, Lance Cpl. Thomas A., 24, Wagoner, Okla. Marines, assigned to Second Low Altitude Air Defense Battalion, Marine Air Control Group 28, Second Marine Aircraft Wing, Cherry Point, N.C.
Following is a list of Americans killed in the Iraq war reported since Saturday by the Department of Defense.
Following is a list of Americans killed in the Iraq war reported since Saturday by the Department of Defense:
BLAIR, Lance Cpl. Thomas A., 24, Wagoner, Okla. Marines, assigned to Second Low Altitude Air Defense Battalion, Marine Air Control Group 28, Second Marine Aircraft Wing, Cherry Point, N.C.
CAWLEY, Staff Sgt. James W., 41, Roy, Utah. Marines, assigned to F Company, Second Battalion, 23rd Marine Regiment, Fourth Marine Division, in Salt Lake City.
CURTIN, Specialist Michael Edward, 23, Howell Township, N.J. Army, Second Battalion, Seventh Infantry, Third Infantry Division, Fort Stewart, Ga..
KORTHAUS, Sgt. Bradley S., 28, Scott, Iowa. Marines, assigned to Engineering Company C, Sixth Engineer Support Battalion, Fourth Force Service Support Group, based in Peoria, Ill.
LALUSH, Sgt. Michael V., 23, Troutville, Va., Marines, assigned to Marine Light Attack Helicopter Squadron 169, Marine Air Craft Group 39, Marine Corps Air Station, Camp Pendleton, Calif.
MARTINEZ-FLORES, Pfc. Francisco A., 21, Los Angeles. Marines, assigned to First Tank Battalion, First Marine Division, Marine Corps Air-Ground Combat Center, Twentynine Palms, Calif.
MAY, Staff Sgt. Donald C. Jr., 31, Richmond, Va. Marines, assigned to First Tank Battalion, First Marine Division, Marine Corps Air-Ground Combat Center, Twentynine Palms.
MENUSA, Gunnery Sgt. Joseph, 33, San Jose, Calif. Marines, assigned to First Combat Engineer Battalion, First Marine Division, Camp Pendleton.
O'DAY, Lance Cpl. Patrick T., 20, of Sonoma, Calif. Marines, assigned to First Tank Battalion, First Marine Division, Marine Corps Air-Ground Combat Center, Twentynine Palms.
RINCON, Pfc. Diego Fernando, 19, Conyers, Ga. Army, Second Battalion, Seventh Infantry, Third Infantry Division, Fort Stewart.
SUAREZ, Lance Cpl. Jesus A. Del Solar, 20, Escondido, Calif. Marines, assigned to First Light Armored Reconnaissance Battalion, First Marine Division, Camp Pendleton.
SOLOMON, Sgt. Roderic A., 32, Fayetteville, N.C. Army, assigned to Second Battalion, Seventh Infantry, Third Infantry Division, Fort Stewart.
WELDON, Pfc. Michael Russell Creighton, 20, Conyers, Ga. Army, assigned to Second Battalion, Seventh Infantry, Third Infantry Division, Fort Stewart
WHITE, Lance Cpl. William W., 24, Brooklyn, N.Y. Marines, assigned to Third Amphibious Assault Battalion, First Marine Division, Camp Pendleton.
WILLIAMS, Lance Cpl. Michael J., Yuma, Ariz. Marines, assigned to First Battalion, Second Marine Regiment, Second Marine Expeditionary Brigade, Camp Lejeune, N.C.
WILLIAMS, Sgt. Eugene, 24, Highland, N.Y. Army, Second Battalion, Seventh Infantry, Third Infantry Division, Fort Stewart.
A NATION AT WAR
